page.title: 06HOME LIFE IN NORTHWOLD
page.content: Early morning starts with doorstep delivery of milk,bread and other dairy produce.The postman delivers mail and parcels daily.Newspapers and periodicals are also delivered daily.The majority of vegetables,much fruit and some meat are home produced with surplus stocks stored in the freezer for use in winter months.Most families travel 12-20 miles to nearby towns for a weekly or monthly shop and use the village shops for top-up supplies or forgotten items.Young children attend the village playgroup and until 11 years old children are educated within the village.Most families own dogs,cats or rabbits and several own goats for milk production or grass cutting services. Entertainment tends to be home based. Family life prevails.
